They have escort services and many more ways to keep students safe.
I am not a part of greek life.
There are so many clubs. One I am joining is the psych. club because my major is psychology. There are tons of activities, like a scavenger hunt we had in our dorm.
Great for any type of student.
There is a book called the traditions book and you have to get so many pictures doing so many activities and if you get them all then you get to wear a medallion at your graduation.
I would choose the University of Northern Iowa if you are still wondering what school to go to.
For fun just in the first few weeks I have met new friends, gone to an outdoor movie, played sports, and gone to christian meetings.
The food is good and the dining center is nice.
The dorm life is good. It is comfy and the people are friendly.
This school is not to tough but it always depends on what classes you are taking.
Bring enough stuff.
The University of Northern Iowa is a great school. The teachers are nice. The on campus living is nice.
pageTitle: University of Northern Iowa (UNI) Reviews: Student Reviews and Ratings | Cappex
TableContextTimeStampAfterTable: {352409=The University of Northern Iowa has a renowned Business Program; In 2013, the CPA exam pass percentage for students sitting was 100% on all four sections. The college offers hundreds of organizations to get involved in, and the community of the college is almost like a family. UNI is a great choice for a student looking to pursue an education in everything from business to philosophy., 71897=I love it here. Even though I don't live on campus, I am generally on campus from morning until like 10:00 PM because there are so many events/activities that go on throughout the week. It isn't too big and it isn't too small and all of my professors for my classes have done a great job teaching. I have also been able to connect with other Christians on campus through Intervarsity, Fellowship of Christian Athletes, BASIC Plus, BASIC, and Navigators. There are so many ministries and campus clubs/organizations that one can get involved in., 240390=Apply early, scholarship deadlines are early January., 393998=© 2015, Cappex.com, LLC}
textBeforeTable: 07/14/2009 Reviewer is A current student here. 14 out of 15 people found this review useful. 1 of 88 Greg from Alton, IA Check out reviews left by other students or leave your own review. You could win a free scholarship. textAfterTable: Am learning a lot There are tons of different classes and majors to choose from. The Liberal arts core helps you decided what you actual want to be and makes you a well rounded student. Login to rate or flag the reviews Katelyn from Ames, IA 01/05/2011 Reviewer is Researching this school. Reviewer has been to campus. 2 out of 2 people found this review useful. 3 of 88 Categories Comments Great for these types of students Great for students looking to go into a career in education. Tips for prospective students I would recommend to keep up on the readings for every class. Get the readings done before class so you can use the class discussions as a review. Also, get involved in extracurricular activities from the very beginning. Take advantage of opportunities that arise. Use the activities to meet new friends. Make the most out of your college experience, and most of all, have fun! Bang for
